snippet: Two palatial houses on the market — one in Little Silver, the other in Montville — have style and age differences, but also a surprising amount in common.
abstract: Historic mansion in Little Silver, NJ, that was formerly owned by 1929 Olympic figure skater Harold Hartshorne is on the market for $5.9 million, and Montville mansion owned by Real Housewives of New Jersey star Melissa Gorga and her husband Joe is being sold for $3.8 million; homes have much in common, including the challenges and advantages of selling property with celebrity ties.
lead_paragraph: Two palatial houses on the market — one in Little Silver, the other in Montville — have style and age differences, but also a surprising amount in common.

headline.seo: New Jersey/In the Region — Celebrity Luxe, Then and Now
